item.title: By: Nate Eagle
item.dc:creator: Nate Eagle
item.description: Dude, one of the most famous josekis in all of go is "the magic/cursed sword". The metaphor of combat is essential to go.
item.content:encoded: Dude, one of the most famous josekis in all of go is “the magic/cursed sword”. The metaphor of combat is essential to go.

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: How could one eer have too much Hikaru no Go? xD Haha.
item.content:encoded: How could one eer have too much Hikaru no Go? xD Haha.

item.title: By: Martin Siepermann
item.dc:creator: Martin Siepermann
item.description: Using the words sword and blade in a go context is a sure sign of the infamous To-much-Hikaru-no-go-desease ... ;-)
item.content:encoded: Using the words sword and blade in a go context is a sure sign of the infamous To-much-Hikaru-no-go-desease … ðŸ˜‰

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Hahaha. Don't worry man. It was a necessary wake up call. And perhaps you're right, my attacks probably are more analogous to a club than anything else. But no more! I will forge a blade worthy of legend! xD
item.content:encoded: Hahaha. Don’t worry man. It was a necessary wake up call. And perhaps you’re right, my attacks probably are more analogous to a club than anything else. But no more! I will forge a blade worthy of legend! xD

item.title: By: Moboy78
item.dc:creator: Moboy78
item.description: D: I didn't mean for it to sound like that. "After all, up until this point, I always thought that I simÂ­ply had misÂ­guided attacks that were strong while lackÂ­ing in preÂ­cise and accuÂ­rate moveÂ­ments. In realÂ­ity though, I may have been entirely delusional." I have to disagree with you here. I guess I wasn't as specific as I should have been earlier, but what I meant was that you attacked with a club, not a sword. Sure, you attacked when and what you needed to, but what I had meant was that your attacks didn't strike the vital points. For instance, in our last game, when I tried to live on the right side in your moyo, I felt like I was being herded by a shepherd dog rather than being attacked by wolves. At least in my eyes, it's not as bad as you say. =)
item.content:encoded: D: I didn’t mean for it to sound like that. “After all, up until this point, I always thought that I simÂ­ply had misÂ­guided attacks that were strong while lackÂ­ing in preÂ­cise and accuÂ­rate moveÂ­ments. In realÂ­ity though, I may have been entirely delusional.” I have to disagree with you here. I guess I wasn’t as specific as I should have been earlier, but what I meant was that you attacked with a club, not a sword. Sure, you attacked when and what you needed to, but what I had meant was that your attacks didn’t strike the vital points. For instance, in our last game, when I tried to live on the right side in your moyo, I felt like I was being herded by a shepherd dog rather than being attacked by wolves. At least in my eyes, it’s not as bad as you say. =)
